questions.question: What is programming?
choices: Creating a set of instructions for computers to follow
questions.answer: Creating a set of instructions for computers to follow

questions.question: Who created Python?
In what year was Python created?
What is the correct extension for Python files?
Which of the following is NOT a key feature of Python?
What is the Python shell?
choices: A protective case for your computer
An interactive environment for entering Python commands
questions.answer: An interactive environment for entering Python commands

questions.question: Which command is used to print output in Python?
What does 'interpreted language' mean in the context of Python?
choices: The code needs to be translated to another language
The code is executed directly without prior compilation
The code is only partially executed
The code is always faster than compiled languages
questions.answer: The code is executed directly without prior compilation

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a common application area for Python?
What is the purpose of significant whitespace in Python?
choices: To make the code look prettier
To define the structure and scope of the code
questions.answer: To define the structure and scope of the code

questions.question: Which company was NOT mentioned as using Python extensively?
What is a Python script?
Which of these is NOT a benefit of using Python for beginners?
What does 'cross-platform compatibility' mean for Python?
choices: It can only run on one type of computer
It can run on various operating systems like Windows, macOS, and Linux
It can transform into other programming languages
It can only be used for cross-platform game development
questions.answer: It can run on various operating systems like Windows, macOS, and Linux

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a Python library mentioned for data science?
What is the primary purpose of the 'print()' function in Python?
choices: To display output on the screen
questions.answer: To display output on the screen

questions.question: Which of these is a correct 'Hello, World!' program in Python?
What does IDE stand for in the context of programming?
Which of these is NOT a valid variable name in Python?
What is the purpose of comments in Python code?
choices: To make the code run faster
To prevent certain code from executing
To provide explanations and improve code readability
questions.answer: To provide explanations and improve code readability

questions.question: Which symbol is used for single-line comments in Python?
What is the result of 3 + 2 * 4 in Python?
Which of these data types is mutable in Python?
What does the 'len()' function do in Python?
choices: Calculates the length of a sequence or collection
questions.answer: Calculates the length of a sequence or collection

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a valid way to create a string in Python?
What is the purpose of the 'if __name__ == "__main__":' statement in Python?
choices: To define the main function of the program
To check if the script is being run directly or being imported
questions.answer: To check if the script is being run directly or being imported

questions.question: Which of these is NOT a valid comparison operator in Python?
What is the output of 'print(type(42))'?

What does the 'import' keyword do in Python?
choices: Allows you to use code from other modules
questions.answer: Allows you to use code from other modules
